job_description: Sr. AI Engineer (Infrastructure as Code) - job post Toyota 110 reviews Plano, TX 75024 • Hybrid remote Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Overview Who we are At Toyota, we are reimagining mobility through innovative, high-quality technology solutions designed to enhance lives and meet our company mission of “Producing Happiness for All.” If you are interested in reimagining mobility with us in an inclusive environment built on teamwork that puts respect for people first, we want to talk to you. This position is based in Plano, TX. Toyota encourages all employees to live within a reasonable commuting distance of their assigned work location. Hybrid work from outside of the assigned work location may be permitted in a pre-approved list of states (AZ, CA, CO, GA, IL, IN, KY, MA, MI, MO, NJ, NY, OH, OR, TN, TX, VA, WV) with certain stipulations. Speak with your recruiter and hiring manager to learn more about our hybrid work program. To save time applying, Toyota does not offer sponsorship of job applicants for employment-based visas or any other work authorization for this position at this time. Who we’re looking for Toyota’s OneTech organization is looking for smart, passionate, and highly motivated Technology leader to join our Digital Engineering team who has a keen sense of ownership and strong engineering, mindset. As a Sr. Engineer in Digital Engineer team you will be responsible for architecting, designing, building solutions that would serve TMNA infrastructure, application and end user services environments. The primary responsibility of this role is to strategize, plan and build digital solutions working in collaboration with technology leaders of every OneTech function, sales, manufacturing, and other functions as the Digital engineering span across North America facilities. The candidate will work across the OneTech to architect, developed solutions in accordance with TMNA standards. The position requires strategic and deep customer focused thinking, technical skill to architect, build new solutions and make faster decisions. We are looking for self-motivated individuals who are highly detailed oriented and take pride in their deliverables. Ability to work with technology leaders across OneTech to design, architect and build new solutions. Ability to learn, critical thinking, to design new solutions using Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning (AI/ML), cloud and other technologies. This role is also responsible to bring innovation to respective business portfolio. Reporting to the Sr. Manager, the person in this role will support the Digital Platform Engineering department’s objective to embark on a large-scale modernization to automate our on-prem legacy infrastructure, application, and end user services environments to modern, automated, software-driven self-services-based solutions. What you’ll be doing Responsible for architecting, designing and building solutions that would serve TMNA infrastructure, application and end user services environments Responsible for driving strategic vision for the Digital ensuring a robust product roadmap to support the Toyota’s digital solutions strategy Build framework and governance Lead architecture meetings and technical discussions with the focus of reaching consensus and best practice solutions Break down tasks for other engineers and offer guidance to other engineers on the team when they are blocked Create engaging technical content including writing internal company blog posts, white-papers, practical guides, and platform demos Stay current with industry trends and recommend relevant technologies and products in the areas of on prem and cloud Champion and drive digital transformation enterprise wide to improve their effectiveness and efficiency through Be the technical lead for Digital team that provides Infrastructure, Application delivery Be a trusted liaison between Digital and other DPE teams Lead, coach, pair with, and mentor engineers and architects of diverse backgrounds Engage in code and architecture reviews helping maintain our coding standards and provide cost optimization guidance for running the Platform Meet with stakeholders and business leaders to identify opportunities, improve overall efficiencies using solutions. What you bring Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Systems or related discipline, or equivalent work experience Experience in using AI/ML technologies, configuration management, deployment, infrastructure orchestration, monitoring, and analytics Experience using knowledge in programming languages and coding software like Python, Ansible, etc.- with the ability to lead through ambiguity while partnering across organizations Experience with developing infrastructure using tools like PagerDuty, DataDog, AppNeta, Microsoft SCOM, Nagios etc., Experience with Cloud technologies, AWS, GCP, and Azure for deployment, and lifecycle management of SaaS solutions Experience using communication (verbal/written) and collaboration, time management skills, decision making and organizational abilities Extensive ability to research the latest trends and propose advanced tooling/solutions for infrastructure management and Experience leveraging AWS/Azure/GCP Platform to deploy highly reliable and scalable cloud applications Experience working with systems design; integration of computing, storage, and network technologies to deliver cohesive infrastructure solutions Added bonus if you have Understanding of the latest tools, and technologies in the AI/ML space Experience using Multicloud GitHub presence with contribution and/or collaboration with open-source communities Experience working in large, multi-faceted, and matrixed organizations Experience as an Observability engineer What we’ll bring During your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities. A few highlights include: A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement Vehicle purchase & lease programs Comprehensive health care and wellness plans for your entire family Flextime and virtual work options (if applicable) Toyota 401(k) Savings Plan featuring a company match, as well as an annual retirement contribution from Toyota regardless of whether you contribute Paid holidays and paid time off Referral services related to prenatal services, adoption, childcare, schools, and more Flexible spending accounts Relocation assistance (if applicable) Belonging at Toyota Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. Respect for all is our North Star. Toyota is proud to have 10+ different Business Partnering Groups across 100 different North American chapter locations that support team members’ efforts to dream, do and grow without questioning that they belong. As a company that has been one of DiversityInc’s Top 50 Companies for Diversity and a member of The Billion Dollar Roundtable supporting minority and woman-owned suppliers for over 10 years, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business. Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law. Have a question or need assistance with your application? Check out the How to Apply section of our careers page on Toyota.com or send an email to talent.acquisition@toyota.com.

Director of Commercial Data Science - job post PepsiCo 18,123 reviews Plano, TX Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Overview This is a role for a director of Data Science responsible to deliver data science and analytics capabilities for consumer metrics in the areas of predictive measurement underneath the global commercial data science. This role will be accountable for ROI Engine within PepsiCo. This includes data feature engineering to prepare data at scale for predictive and optimization models, ensuring that ML models and other data science artifacts conform to predefined standards, productionization and deployable models in PepsiCo’s analytical platforms. This role will also ensure sharing and application of best practices for design using standard tools while supporting advancing the state of the art in data science. This role will have responsibility of managing existing models (media mix modeling, predictive sales predictions, etc) and testing new methodologies for global deployment. It is important to ensure on-time and on-budget delivery of solutions and products, satisfying product requirements while adhering to Data+Analytics and other PepsiCo architecture and technology standards, as applicable. This role will collaborate closely with D+A Data Management Organization, Digital Products and Services Business Engagement and Product leads and global and sector stakeholders as needed regarding execution of product development workstreams and strategic alignment across programs to ensure maximum reusability of analytical assets created by the Data Science and application of best practices in delivering data science products. Responsibilities Lead a team of Data Scientists in the application of modern data science and machine learning principles to address a wide range of business problems across various functional groups within PepsiCo Define project roadmaps and manage project flow to ensure timely delivery of impactful products Provide critical thought leadership to enhance organizational capabilities by utilizing big and small data; work with business leaders and strategic partners to identify and execute on opportunities for enhancement Act as the technical representative for PepsiCo’s Data Science organization Lead delivery of key consumer data priorities within time and budget, particularly around feature engineering, deploying and sustaining ML / AI models Ensure on time and on budget delivery which satisfies product requirements, while adhering to D+A standards. Manage work intake, prioritization and release timing; balancing demand and available resources. Ensure tactical product releases are aligned with the strategic vision and business needs Accountable for work intake supporting implementation, deployment and initial support of data science components in strategic project investments, and resulting business value Accountable for application of common ML scaling and refactoring approaches to ensure that products that are built by Data Scientists can scale to meet the requirements of sectors, service level agreements of execution and expected user experience Partners with Strategy and Transformation Data+Analytics and Digital Product & Services leads, global functional business leads and users, and Sector Leads to ensure that data science products meet business strategies, support S&T direction, and drive business value Lead a team of employee and contract resources to meet product delivery needs, ensuring that strategic direction and knowledge are kept in PepsiCo for future work Set priorities for the team to ensure task completion Hold team accountable for milestone deliverables Continue the build-up of the team including roles for workstream leaderships and machine learning/optimization engineers Manage partnership with talent sourcing vendors Partner with technology vendors as needed Drive the use and application of D+A standards including frameworks, analytical toolkits, data science workbenches and MLOps tool chains and to also focus on 'the art of the possible' demonstrations to the business Actively participate in collaboration across S&T’s digital hubs across Dallas, Barcelona and other S&T locations (e.g. Hyderabad-India, Mexico) Qualifications Master’s Degree in Data Science or equivalent, Ph.D. Preferred 10 years of relevant work experience, 8 years with a Ph.D. At least 4 years of software development and machine learning experience in a business environment Experience leading technical teams Expert in mathematical models underlying data science methods especially Kalman Filter Demonstrated ability to effectively and concisely communicate with both business and technical audiences 3-5+ years of experience leading/building advanced analytics and big data solutions 2-3+ years managing large virtual teams - experience managing large global teams preferred Knowledge of the data science art (feature engineering, modeling, AI capabilities, optimizers) and related technologies (cloud computing, open source analytical capabilities) Demonstrated ability to drive innovative solutions using data science, feature engineering and machine learning Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization Demonstrated flexibility to manage resources to plan, including effectively handling spikes in demand Solves highly complex problems across teams Strong people management skills with the ability to develop teams and cultivate talent, including teams composed of various experience levels Experience with consumer datasets and marketing data preferred COVID-19 vaccination is a condition of employment for this role. Please note that all such company vaccine requirements provide the opportunity to request an approved accommodation or exemption under applicable law EEO Statement All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. Data Science Senior Associate - job post RSM US LLP 818 reviews Dallas, TX 75240 Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time As a senior associate in RSM’s growing Risk Consulting Practice, you will have the opportunity to draw from your experience and knowledge while continuing to grow your leadership skills through a high degree of client and industry exposure, career development and mentorship opportunities, and a diverse and inclusive culture. The fast-paced and dynamic environment in which we operate will provide you with daily challenges and exciting opportunities. The Risk Consulting Practice primarily works within our client’s risk management functions across the three lines of defense. This includes internal audit, the chief risk officer or risk function and various other members of management tasked with managing risk. Our advisors assist our clients identifying, evaluating, and prioritizing risk. The team scopes, develops and deploys bespoke solutions to help our clients reduce risk exposure. This role is a unique opportunity for an experienced practitioner in data science and analytics to work with a likeminded team to produce cutting edge solutions that assist financial institutions mange major risk of today’s environment. Key Responsibilities Client Experience: Learn about the clients that we serve within the financial services industry, and leverage your understanding to become your clients’ trusted advisor Facilitate discussions with client stakeholders to understand current state of the business process, the pain points and success criteria of the potential solution(s) Collect data requirements, identify relevant data sources, obtain and understand data Perform data transformations, data joining/blending, data profiling, data cleansing, and other data movement related activities Determine different machine learning (ML) algorithms fit for purpose based on business and data understanding Participate in the development of ML models within an Agile team made of internal and external resources Produce tidy code including comments and docstrings to enable other project team members to understand functionality developed Follow source code management protocols (e.g. Git) to effectively version models during development and allow multiple resources to work on separate functionality simultaneously Interpret the results of ML models and clearly and effectively communicate results to technical and non-technical audiencesCoach/mentor junior or client staff on data analytic tools and techniques. Contributions to Firm Culture: Model the core RSM values of respect, integrity, teamwork, excellence and stewardship in all interactions with clients and team members Be open to new ideas and challenges, and help foster a culture that encourages people to ask questions, seek diverse perspectives, and challenge those around you Develop executive presence through interactions with management within RSM and our clients Develop meaningful relationships with client personnel and colleagues Support RSM’s goals around diversity and inclusion by nurturing an environment that understands individuality, promotes authenticity, and values varied perspective in arriving at solutions Position Qualifications: Undergraduate or Master’s degree in MIS, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Analytics or Accounting, or equivalent level of education Minimum of 2 years experience with open-source programming languages like R or Python Minimum of 1-2 years of professional experience with ML modeling Ability to travel to meet client needs and work collaboratively with others in-person and remotely Openness to workday flexibility, agility, remote work environment, leveraging new tools Effective communication skills, both verbally and in writing Effective time management and prioritization skills Preferred Skills (optional): Minimum of 1-2 years of professional experience in banking, insurance, or related industry Experience with data analytics/science tools such as Alteryx, SQL, Tableau, and Power BI Experience processing large amounts of data, including data collection (API, database querying, flat files, etc.), data mining, data transformation, and data profiling. 1-2 years’ experience working with Agile Teams Familiarity with tools like Github and Jira for source code management Experience developing and presenting results using Jupyter Notebooks. Experience with Azure ML or Amazon SageMaker RSM’s vision is to be the first-choice advisor to middle market leaders globally. You will work directly with clients, key decision makers and business owners across various industries and geographies to deliver a top quality client experience. RSM is a diverse and inclusive place where you will work as part of a team while being valued as an individual, mentored as a future leader, and recognized for your accomplishments. The firm offers a competitive benefits package, base compensation, and an employee bonus program for eligible roles based on individual and firm performance per program guidelines. Base compensation ranges can be found between the ranges noted below in the posting, and an actual offer can vary based upon on role, hiring location, and qualifications. For additional information on RSM’s total rewards, visit our website at https://rsmus.com/careers/working-at-rsm/benefits.html. If required by applicable law or client policy, you may be required to be vaccinated for COVID-19 or have an approved accommodation. You want your next step to be the right one. You've worked hard to get where you are today. And now you're ready to use your unique skills, talents and personality to achieve great things. RSM is a place where you are valued as an individual, mentored as a future leader, and recognized for your accomplishments and potential. Working directly with clients, key decision makers and business owners across various industries and geographies, you'll move quickly along the learning curve and our clients will benefit from your fresh perspective. Experience RSM US. Experience the power of being understood. RSM is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans.

Sustainability-ESG Senior Data Analyst (Range) - job post Pioneer Natural Resources Company 22 reviews Irving, TX Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Job Description Job Summary: This position will support the Sustainable Development team by preparing technical data for interpretation, conducting analysis of data, creating visualizations and dashboards, and managing complex projects, including various aspects of data management, database management, automation, process improvements and data integration. This individual must be able to recommend, develop and support implementation of new processes, and must be knowledgeable with data models and management for analysis and data integrity to assist Sustainable Development team and the company with making data driven decisions. Major Responsibilities: Collaborate with team members and customers to identify informational needs and provide analytics/reporting as needed. Develop automated reports, conduct analysis and provide insight into key performance metrics and create final displays of the results, often for formal presentations. Evaluate current processes around data entry, data QC, report distribution and provide recommendations and solutions on optimizing existing processes. Able to summarize data and to assemble tables, digital graphics and maps in PowerPoint presentations. Able to identify trends and correlations as well as outliers and data busts. Must be able to recognize and identify data problems and research suitable solutions and or workarounds. Identify and provide solutions for process redundancies/inefficiencies and automation opportunities. Communicate issues and needs, as well as support, systems development and improvement. Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required, preferably in data analytics, computer science, mathematics, engineering, or related area. Master’s degree preferred. 4-7 years of experience in an analyst role. Experience in the oil and gas industry is preferred. Advanced proficiency in MS Office suite required. Proficient skills designing SQL queries required. Understanding of programming languages such as Python, R, or similar is preferred. Experience with data visualization (e.g., Spotfire, Tableau, Power BI) applications, Geographic Information Systems, and Alteryx is preferred. Can modify established workflows and evaluate and assess errors as they arise. Can interpret understand and explain workflows and data processes. Understanding of systems architecture, management, and administration is desired. Work has a discernible impact on the business unit. Must be self-directed. Works with technical staff and professionals. Salary competitive and commensurate with qualifications and experience. Pioneer Natural Resources is an EEO Employer.

Senior Data Science & Forecasting Analyst - job post Republic Finance 335 reviews 6501 Windcrest Dr, Plano, TX 75024 Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Overview and Responsibilities: At Republic Finance, we are building a leading consumer lending company. In business for more than 70 years, we are proud to be a trusted lender in over 250 communities across the Central and Southeastern United States! We specialize in providing flexible lending solutions and incomparable customer service. Driven by our shared mission to pursue excellence for our team, our customers, and our performance, Republic Finance is continuously improving our online customer offerings in tandem with opening more branches in new states each year. We also regularly promote from within and enjoy giving back to the communities we serve. In a nutshell, our company culture is about helping customers, investing in our employee's future, and ensuring that our overall performance makes an impact on our community. Republic Finance is seeking a Senior Analyst or Manager for the Data Science and Forecasting team. This is a key role with significant and broad responsibilities. This role will report to the Director of Forecasting and be a member of a 10 person Credit Policy and Analytics team with substantial opportunity for future growth within the company in concert with driving business expansion. As a team-member responsible for analyzing portfolio performance and trends, building/managing models for financial forecasting, developing strategic insights to shape credit policy, and serving as a key thought leader on all credit strategy decisions, lending decisions and overall balance sheet performance. You will work closely with Finance, Operations, Risk and external partners to collaborate on broader strategic initiatives and shape the direction and growth of the overall business in a collaborative dynamic team environment. Strategic decisions will require balancing growth, credit risk and profitability. Job responsibilities are as follows: Continuously challenge and enhance assumptions and forecasting through analysis of customer behavior data and sophisticated statistical and financial modeling. Similarly enable efficient diagnosis of root cause for variance from performance expectations Establish a robust infrastructure for scenario testing and experiment design and evaluation for lending strategies. Recommend updates to possible scenarios, associated risks and opportunities around business performance. Analyze and forecast performance assumptions for portfolio growth/performance, and credit policy strategies that integrate robust analytical techniques. Maintain transparent communication and trust with all key stakeholders on results and strategic impacts. Analyze risks and opportunity considerations and present insights to guide executives on business decisions. Develop and maintain a robust economic framework that will serve as the foundation for business decision-making. Identify and size second and third order impact resulting from strategic decision and policy or process changes Assist in building and maintain a rigorous performance monitoring framework and associated management dashboards that readily highlight areas of confidence and areas in need of further evaluation for resolution of concerns or exploitation of opportunities. Requirements: Experience of 3-6 years in the unsecured or Auto credit space including credit cards or installment lending at a sophisticated issuer of revolving and term loans. Expert SQL and Python skills required, and statistical modeling experience highly desired Familiarity with statistical modeling and forecasting, portfolio P&L simulation, vintage profitability tracking and marginal expansion strategies. CECL Modeling experience highly desired Strong communication and presentation skills, leadership skills, a high level of initiative, intellectual curiosity and creativity, and a robust understanding of the consumer lending business Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline is required, advanced degree is preferred. Benefits: We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package including: Health/Dental/Vision Paid Time Off (PTO) 401 (K) and employer match Company provided Life Insurance & Long Term Disability Additional benefits with Republic Finance include: Employee of the Month Program Philanthropic support for charities such as Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation and the American Cancer Society Professional offices with a friendly team environment Republic Finance, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age disability or veteran status in employment opportunities and benefits. Republic Finance, LLC maintains a Drug-Free Workplace. If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Data Scientist Lead - job post JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A. (part of JPMorgan Chase & Co) 8,775 reviews Plano, TX Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time JOB SUMMARY The Data Analytics and Reporting (DART) team's mission is to provide high-quality dashboards & insights that executive leadership will use to monitor KPIs, steer the business, and make investment decisions. This team will constantly balance the need for speed with the importance of providing accurate results, to enable leadership to make informed decisions with agility & precision. The position will be part of a team that will take a loosely-defined idea or problem statement, find & acquire the relevant data, design & build the dashboards, develop the automated workflows, and document the details. You will also help to develop frameworks to ensure cross-platform data & logic consistency and optimization. They will write code to enrich and transform data sets to produce output that will help to advance the DART teams objectives and impact to the broader organization. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES Manage a group of exempt analysts with a focus on maintaining an IT application and doing all necessary preparation to make the application audit ready Lend expertise and mentor others in regards to code/work review (Python Scripts, Java Script, ETL jobs, Alteryx Workflows, Database design) Interface with controls partners and senior leadership to present information regarding audit readiness Perform data analysis to define / support model development including metadata and data dictionary documentation that will enable data analysis and analytical exploration Participate in strategic projects and provide ideas and inputs on ways to leverage quantitative analytics to generate actionable business insights and/or solutions to influence business strategies and identify opportunities to grow Partners closely with business partners to identify impactful projects, influence key decisions with data, and ensure client satisfaction REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS, CAPABILITIES AND SKILLS Scripting skills e.g. Python, R Strong understanding of data and database methodologies as well as hands on Oracle and/or AWS Cloud experience 10+ years of experience across broad range of analytics platforms, languages, and tools (SAS, SQL, Spark and Python, Unix, Excel Pivot etc.); hands-on experience using big data platform required 10+ years experience working for a large financial institution (preferably a bank and/or credit union) Strong understanding of CI/CD Pipelines in a globally distributed environment using Git, Bit-Bucket, Jenkins, Spinnaker, etc. Experience with the entire Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) including planning, analysis, development and testing of new applications and enhancements to existing application Experience leading teams of exempt individual contributors to drive completion complex results oriented projects Risk and controls experience in a corporate setting with a focus on identifying and remediating IT related control breaks/issues Audit readiness/preparation experience for business and IT settings PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS, CAPABILITIES AND SKILLS Bachelor's Degree in a relevant field (e.g. Statistics, Economics, Finance, Business Leadership, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science or any related fields involving significant quantitative research & data analytics) with 12 years of experience OR a Master's degree in a relevant field with 10 years of experience Strong communicator who's able to convey complex information in an understandable, compelling, and persuasive manner to business partners Results-oriented with a strong attention to details Strong knowledge in quantitative methods for business analytics; proficiency in critical thinking and problem solving Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America's households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Senior Decision Science Manager - job post CAR CAPITAL CORPORATION 5 reviews Grapevine, TX 76051 Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Position Overview: Car Capital Technologies is seeking a Senior Decision Science Manager who will work with the Chief Risk Officer on managing current and building future generations of scoring models to help manage the business. If you have a proven track record of leveraging data to build statistical models to help the business make better decisions then we want to discuss this exciting opportunity to build something great here at Car Capital. As the Senior Manager, you’ll own the scoring model performance and creation for managing the risk dynamics of portfolio acquisition and performance. You will be responsible for driving end-to-end product life cycle scoring and decision making. This position will leverage existing data and technological infrastructure to deliver near real time decisions available for enterprise consumption and analysis. The role will also be the key driver of exploration on new data sources and possible integration with decision making processes. This role has a competitive comp and benefits structure. Education & Experience: Minimum Qualifications You are a motivated, proactive Data Modeler with a clear idea of how to do consumer loan portfolio score development, monitoring and analysis. In addition, you possess the following: 8-10 years of consumer credit risk score model development experience, or equivalent Proficient with various analytical tools (querying data warehouses, consolidating data, cleaning up and delivering presentation layer tools that permit detailed analysis) High-degree of technical knowledge. Experience with various data modeling tools (SAS, R, Tableau, Python, etc.) a definite must.
